Time Series PR to EIR

Computing a fitted EIR time series from PR time series data

October 04, 2024

Fitting_pr2eir.Rmd
library(knitr)
library(ramp.xds)
library(ramp.work)

A dynamical systems model, ℳ\mathcal M, describing malaria…

Step-Ahead Fitting

Suppose we have a time series with observations:

x1,x2,x3,…,xnx_1, x_2, x_3, \ldots, x_n

at time points

t1,t2,t3,…,tnt_1, t_2, t_3, \ldots, t_n

we are looking for a set of ar values:

α1,α2,α3,…,αn\alpha_1, \alpha_2, \alpha_3, \ldots, \alpha_n

Let Fℳ(t,αt,yt,ℳ)=yt+1F_{\mathcal M}(t, \alpha_t, y_t, {\mathcal M}) = y_{t+1} be a function that solves (updates) the model, ℳ\mathcal M once at time tt and returns the state variables yy

The pseudo-code for the fitting algorithm is:

  • initialize the model, ℳ\mathcal M, such that

    • Fℳ(t1,α1,y1,ℳ)=y1F_{\mathcal M}(t_1, \alpha_1, y_1, {\mathcal M}) = y_1

    • Fobs(y1)=x1F_{obs}(y_1) = x_1

  • Iteratively compute α2\alpha_2 such that:

    • Fℳ(t,αt,yt,ℳ)=yt+1F_{\mathcal M}(t, \alpha_t, y_t, {\mathcal M}) = y_{t+1}

    • Fobs(yt+1)=xt+1F_{obs}(y_{t+1}) = x_{t+1}

Verification

This function probably needs to get pushed into the code somehow.

show_pr = function(model, get_pr=F_pr, i=1){
  y = get_inits(model, flatten=TRUE)
  get_pr(list_Xvars(y, model, 1), model$Xpar[[1]])
}

We set up a model:

SI <- xds_setup(Xname = "SIS", MYZname = "SI")

Note that the initial conditions are not what we wanted:

show_pr(SI)

We initialize the model to have a PrPR

SI <- dts_init_by_pr(.4, SI, F_pr, 365)
show_pr(SI)

We find the attack rate at the steady state:

ar <- dts_pr2ar_step(.4, si, F_pr)
ar

and we generate a time series:

set.seed(230)
ar_ts <- ar*c(1, rlnorm(14, 1, 1))
ar_ts

We use it to create a PfPR time series:

si1 = si
pr_ts = show_pr(si1)
for(i in 2:length(ar_ts)){
  y = update_by_ar(ar_ts[i], si1, 1)
  si1 = update_inits(y, si1)
  pr_ts = c(pr_ts, show_pr(si1))
}
pr_ts

Now, we pass the PfPR time series to dts_pr2ar_ts and test that it returns our AR time series:

ar_t <- dts_pr2ar_ts(pr_ts, si, F_pr)
sum((ar_ts-ar_t)^2) < 1e-9
